data.text:
If you’re looking for a convenient way to explore Singapore’s southern coast, look no further than Marina South Pier MRT Station. As the southern terminus of the North South Line, this underground station is located in the Straits View planning area and offers easy access to nearby attractions such as Marina Bay Sands and Sentosa Island.

Opened in 2014 as part of the NSL Extension, Marina South Pier MRT Station is built adjacent to the Marina South Pier ferry terminal and is connected to the station via a pedestrian underpass. In addition to its convenient location, the station also offers a range of facilities and services for commuters, including shops and dining options.

Whether you’re a local or a tourist, Marina South Pier MRT Station is a great starting point for exploring Singapore’s southern coast. With its convenient location, range of facilities, and easy access to nearby attractions, it’s no wonder that this station is a popular choice for commuters and travellers alike.

Key Takeaways

Marina South Pier MRT Station is the southern terminus of the North South Line and offers easy access to nearby attractions such as Marina Bay Sands and Sentosa Island.

The station is built adjacent to the Marina South Pier ferry terminal and offers a range of facilities and services for commuters, including shops and dining options.

Marina South Pier MRT Station is a popular choice for commuters and travellers looking to explore Singapore’s southern coast.

General Information

If you are looking for a convenient and efficient way to travel in Singapore, you should consider taking the MRT. The Marina South Pier MRT Station is one of the stations on the North-South Line, which is operated by SMRT Trains. The station code for Marina South Pier MRT Station is NS28.

Located in the Straits View area of Singapore, Marina South Pier MRT Station is the southern terminus of the North-South Line. It is situated adjacent to the Marina South Pier ferry terminal and underneath Marina Coastal Drive. The station is named after the pier, which is a popular departure point for tourists visiting the Southern Islands.

Marina South Pier MRT Station is a modern and well-designed station that provides easy access to public transport. It is fully air-conditioned and has a range of facilities, including ticketing machines, retail shops, and toilets. The station is also wheelchair accessible, with lifts and ramps provided for the convenience of passengers with disabilities.

If you are planning to travel on the North-South Line, you can use Marina South Pier MRT Station to connect to other stations on the line. The North-South Line is one of the busiest MRT lines in Singapore, with trains running from early in the morning until late at night. The line is operated by the Land Transport Authority, which is responsible for the development and maintenance of Singapore’s public transport system.

In addition to the North-South Line, Marina South Pier MRT Station is also part of the Thomson-East Coast Line, which is currently under construction. Once completed, the Thomson-East Coast Line will provide even more connectivity and convenience for commuters in Singapore.

Getting There

Getting to Marina South Pier MRT Station is easy and convenient, with several transportation options available. Whether you’re travelling by bus, train, taxi, or car, you’ll find that the station is easily accessible from various parts of Singapore.

By Train

The most convenient way to get to Marina South Pier MRT Station is by train. The station is located on the North-South Line (NS28), which connects to major stations such as Raffles Place and Orchard. If you’re coming from the city centre, take the train towards Marina South Pier and alight at the station.

By Bus

If you prefer to take the bus, there are several bus stops located near Marina South Pier MRT Station. The nearest bus stop is Marina Coastal Drive – Opp Marina Sth Pier Stn (03411), which is just a three-minute walk from the station. You can also take buses 402, 502, and 655 to get to the station.

By Car/Taxi

If you’re driving or taking a taxi, the address of Marina South Pier MRT Station is 31 Marina Coastal Drive, Singapore 018988. There are several pick-up/drop-off points located near the station, including the Marina Bay Cruise Centre Singapore and Marina Boulevard. However, do note that parking is limited, and it can be quite expensive.

Directions

If you’re coming from the city centre, the fastest way to get to Marina South Pier MRT Station is by train. Take the North-South Line (NS28) towards Marina South Pier and alight at the station. If you’re coming from other parts of Singapore, you can use the SBS Transit website to plan your journey and check schedules.

Marina South Pier MRT Station is located on the North-South Line (NS28). From the station, you can easily access other parts of Singapore, including the city centre and Orchard Road. There are also several bus routes that stop near the station.

The cheapest way to get to Marina South Pier MRT Station is by bus. You can take buses 402, 502, and 655 to get to the station. However, do note that the journey may take longer compared to taking the train.

Fastest Way

The fastest way to get to Marina South Pier MRT Station is by train. Take the North-South Line (NS28) towards Marina South Pier and alight at the station. The journey from the city centre takes around 10-15 minutes.

If you don’t have a car, there are several transportation options available to get to Marina South Pier MRT Station. You can take the train, bus, or taxi to get to the station.

Facilities and Services

When you arrive at Marina South Pier MRT Station, you will find a range of facilities and services available to make your journey as comfortable and convenient as possible.

Firstly, if you need to leave the station, you can use Exit B, which is located near the taxi stands. This exit provides easy access to the Marina Coastal Expressway and other nearby destinations.

Inside the station, you will find an island platform, which is used for both arriving and departing trains. The platform is located underground, and there are a range of ticket machines and counters available for purchasing tickets. You can also use your EZ-Link card to pay for your travel.

If you are planning to travel by ferry, the Marina South Pier Ferry Terminal is located adjacent to the station. There are a range of ferry companies operating from this terminal, and you can check travel times and prices using Rome2rio’s travel planner.

When using the station, it is recommended that you check the maps and signage to ensure you are heading in the right direction. There are also a range of commercial services available, including shops and food outlets.

Overall, Marina South Pier MRT Station provides a range of facilities and services to make your journey as smooth as possible. Whether you are travelling by train or ferry, you can be assured of a comfortable and convenient experience.

Nearby Attractions

If you’re looking for things to do near Marina South Pier MRT Station, you’re in luck! There are plenty of attractions in the area that you won’t want to miss.

One of the most popular nearby attractions is the Marina Bay Cruise Centre. This stunning building is the starting point for many cruises departing from Singapore. If you’re not taking a cruise, you can still explore the centre and enjoy the stunning views of the bay.

Another must-see attraction is Gardens by the Bay. This incredible nature park is home to a wide variety of plants and flowers, as well as stunning light displays at night. You can spend hours wandering through the gardens and taking in the scenery.

For a more active experience, head over to Marina Barrage. This unique dam and park offers stunning views of the city skyline, as well as plenty of opportunities for outdoor activities like picnicking and kite-flying.

No matter what your interests are, there’s something for everyone near Marina South Pier MRT Station. So why not take a break from your travels and explore all that this vibrant area has to offer?

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I get from Marina South Pier MRT Station to Marina Bay Cruise Centre?

To get to the Marina Bay Cruise Centre from Marina South Pier MRT Station, you can take a taxi or a bus. Bus services 402 and 402A operate between the two locations.

What are some good food options near Marina South Pier MRT Station?

There are several food options available near Marina South Pier MRT Station. One of the popular options is the Marina South Food Centre, which offers a variety of local dishes. Other options include the Marina Bay Link Mall and Marina One, which have several restaurants and cafes.

Can you show me a map of Marina South Pier MRT Station?

Yes, you can find a map of Marina South Pier MRT Station on the Land Transport Authority website or on Google Maps.

When did Marina South MRT Station first open?

Marina South Pier MRT Station opened on 23 November 2014. It is the southern terminus of the North-South Line.

Are there any ferries departing from Marina South Pier?

Yes, there are several ferry services that operate from Marina South Pier, including services to St. John’s Island, Kusu Island and Lazarus Island.

Which MRT station is closest to Marina Bay Sands?

The closest MRT station to Marina Bay Sands is Bayfront MRT Station, which is located on the Circle Line and the Downtown Line.
